One other question, When some other MOD includes the "000_Toolbar" folder, do we overwrite the existing folder with "theirs"? OR do we NOT include the "000_Toolbar" folder that comes with other MOD's?

It's best to compare the CHANGES.txt file within the 000_Toolbar\ folders, which is the change log of the Toolbar Plugin. There you can see which of the copies is which version, and decide whether you want to overwrite or not.

The alternative is just to skip packaged 000_Toolbar\ folders altogether and always use the latest one from this thread.

Can't say if this has been mentioned before (a search didn't turn anything up), but I would like to request a couple of small features:

* To be able to hide buttons manually. I know mod owners can set this up so that buttons are hidden in certain scenarios, but I would like to be able to override that and hide it myself. Some mods insists on having buttons when they simply aren't needed 99% of the time and hiding them would clean up the toolbar a lot (folders already help considerably!).

* To be able to have multiple toolbars. Again, folders are useful here, but I still think being able to split up buttons between toolbars would be nice. I could have certain buttons which I use a lot show permanently in one toolbar, while others might be off to the side and hidden at the screen border.

They're just small things. In general, I love this plugin .

Seamless updating is not possible from within KSP, because DLLs are hold on to by the game. They can only be overwritten if KSP is not currently running.
